core:process.core:name: Print Document
core:process.core:comment: Prints a previously prepared Print Document. Allow Retry, which is true by default, allows a prompt to continue/retry to be shown in the event of failure. Show Printing is true by default and means a 'Printing, please wait' message is shown when printing starts. If Show Printing is set false then on entry, printing is started but no prompt text is displayed - the intention is to allow the caller's last prompt to continue to be displayed, e.g. a change due message. If printing has not completed after 5 seconds, the prompt changes in any case to say 'please wait' and a cancel buton is made available. If printing fails and is retried, the please wait prompt is always displayed while retrying.

core:executeScriptAction.core:comment: We set this explicitly to stop the ProcessDeviceEvents process responding to printer events. It is set automatically when printing starts, but the printer driver may have cleared it on raising the printer error event.

We set this explicitly to stop the ProcessDeviceEvents process responding to printer events. It is also set automatically when printing starts but the printer driver may have cleared it on raising the printer error event.

core:action.core:comment: Test if Retry Allowed - default true

core:outcomeLink.core:comment: Give up on 3 failed claim attempts.

core:param.value: Error printing {printDocument.title}, Failed to claim printer.
core:param.name: enactor.coreUI.LogMessage

core:action.core:comment: Test if Retry Allowed - default true

core:promptState.core:name: Printing State
core:promptState.core:comment: Print receipt. Prompt timeout is set greater than the default print timeout of 15 seconds.

core:promptState.core:name: Printing State
core:promptState.core:comment: Print receipt. Total prompt timeout is set greater than the default print timeout of 15 seconds.

core:promptState.core:name: Printing State
core:promptState.core:comment: Print receipt. Total prompt timeout is set greater than the default print timeout of 15 seconds.
